articles.content: Ziyad Al-Aly noticed that more and more patients were coming to his Missouri clinic with what he describes as an air of invincibility. It was March 2022, and these patients were vaccinated and booste… [+868 chars]

articles.title: “I Don't Need Sunscreen”: 50 People Who Thought So And Ended Up Looking Like Dorks (New Pics) - Bored Panda
articles.description: Always wear sunscreen, stay hydrated, and try to avoid direct sunlight when it’s super hot outside. It’s the middle of the summer right now and one of the biggest joys for many folks is soaking up some rays and stocking up on vitamin D. Sunlight is important …

articles.author: Jillian Wilson
articles.title: These Simple Tasks Can Cut Your Risk Of Dementia, Study Finds - HuffPost
articles.description: Basic activities (some of which you're probably already doing) can cut your risk of dementia by up to 35%.
articles.content:
The simple task of doing chores is now linked with a reduction in the risk of developing dementia. 
New research is offering some actionable steps we can take to protect our minds from memory loss. … [+4378 chars]

articles.author: Adam Chapman
articles.title: B12 deficiency: The hard to reverse sign in your feet - 'only' symptom in 25% of cases - Express
articles.description: VITAMIN B12 underpins many important functions in the body so it's little wonder that B12 deficiency can be destructive. Included in the litany of symptoms is a hard to reverse sign in the feet that's seen in 'only' 25 percent of cases.
